markdownRemark.html:
As I am typing the first sentence of my first blog ever, I still cannot believe it that I am doing something I absolutely hated when I was young. Writing was never my thing and I sucked at it. Maybe there was too much pressure and the goal was too clear - getting a good score to make your parents proud. That 600 or 800 words requirement was my worst nightmare.

Last time I considered writing blogs was 3 years ago. I even set up a WordPress website and bought a domain on Bluehost. It was stupid that I paid that much money for a CMS with many fancy features only few of which are actually useful for me. I did not know what I was doing and I did not even publish one blog with it as I lost interests. Nowadays I would much prefer a minimal site but with great extensibility and most importantly, as cheap as possible. I guess that is because skills and knowledge give me the freedom or ability to do it in the exact way I want and same with many other things. It also saves A LOT of money. (Running a site like this is almost for free. Just need to pay for a domain such as andyan.dev)

Later I may reflect on things that I often think about but never had a chance to talk about, write about memorable time I spent with other people, or some technology I am interested in.

Maybe I will add a comment section later. Maybe also a dark theme switcher. Maybe…

frontmatter.title: Why blogs?
frontmatter.description: why would a lazy person write blogs?
